title: Speech Therapy
banerDescription: Gain qualifications for diagnosing and treating speech disorders in children, adolescents, and adults.
description:
• Individuals wishing to obtain qualifications to work as a speech therapist
  • Teachers wanting to expand their competencies in speech therapy
  • Pedagogues, psychologists, therapists interested in diagnosing and treating speech disorders
description2: The aim of the studies is to acquire skills in diagnosing and treating children, adolescents, and adults with speech disorders. Graduates will receive a postgraduate diploma, giving them the right to work as a speech therapist in educational institutions such as schools, kindergartens, psychological and pedagogical counseling centers, and educational institutions.
description3: By choosing this field, you will gain comprehensive knowledge and practical skills that will enable you to conduct independent therapy for serious speech disorders.

topics.title: Phonetics and Phonology of Contemporary Polish Language
Formation and Development of Child's Speech
Modern Methods of Examining Speech and Hearing Organs
Speech Rhythm and Artistic Speech Therapy
Early Support of Child's Language Development

modules.title: Module 4: Specialized Issues in Speech Therapy

topics.title: Anatomy and Physiology of Voice and Hearing Organs
Anatomy and Physiology of the Nervous System with Elements of Neurology

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced practitioners in the fields of speech therapy, special education, psychology, and other specialists related to speech disorder therapy.
practices:
• The internship includes 180 hours and allows gaining experience in speech therapy diagnosis and treatment.
  • Possibility to complete internships at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center.
evaluation: Assessment of learning outcomes is based on activity during classes, completion of individual modules, implementation of internships, and preparation of a diploma thesis.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Speech therapists in educational institutions (schools, kindergartens)
  • Specialists in psychological and pedagogical counseling centers
  • Therapists in educational institutions
  • Consultants in therapeutic institutions
  • Employees of rehabilitation centers
  • Specialists in private speech therapy practices
invite: Gain the knowledge and skills necessary to work as a speech therapist and support speech development in children, adolescents, and adults.
